summary: Transliterate a string or your input
name: Translit3
install_details:
You can install this plugin using scriptmanager (vimscript #2905) plugin (install scriptmanager, call scriptmanager#Install(["translit3"]) and add ``call scriptmanager#Activate(["translit3"])'' to your .vimrc, then reload vim. Vim-addon-manager will install all dependencies for you). You can also use archives attached to this page, they contain plugin with all dependencies, so you do not need to fetch them yourself. First version present on this page needs no dependencies.

Gentoo users can use the following mercurial overlay: http://vimpluginloader.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/vimpluginloader/pluginloader-overlay.

versions.release_notes: Added ConfigDir option, added tests, some bug fixes
Made `Transliterate' mapping (it shows prompt and transliterates user input) use stuf/cinput function (so that this prompts now have their own history) and new completion
This is the first version published here that contains translit3 splitted into 6 plugins
This is the first version published here that contains translit3 splitted into 6 plugins
